title: spack dev-build does not use local code if the package is in S3 build cache

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I am using an S3 build cache for my development. I installed an older version of an internal package to the build cache, and then tried to "dev-build" the same package with local code. I had expected dev-build to use my local code, but it instead pulled the package from the S3 build cache.

### Spack version
```console
$ spack --version
0.14.0
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

With an S3 mirror:

```console
$ spack buildcache create --key <key fingerprint> --rel --allow-root --directory s3://build-cache mypackage@develop
$ cd src/mypackage
$ spack dev-build --until install mypackage@develop
[...]
==> 17763: Installing mypackage
==> Finding buildcaches at s3://build-cache/build_cache
==> Already downloaded /tmp/.../spack-stage/build_cache/linux-ubuntu18.04-skylake_avx512-gcc-7.4.0-mypackage-rust-docker-refactor-eszw62hjhfhhhkuhmc46iyk4ui7q4fss.spack
==> Installing mypackage from binary cache
...
```

### Information on your system
Ubuntu 18.04
No custom config except one local repo, and an S3 mirror/buildcache

### General information

- [ x ] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [ x ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ x ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
